questions.question: According to the research of Dr. Fritz-Albert Popp discussed in Lesson 1, what is the primary characteristic of biophoton emission in healthy versus diseased cells?

Healthy cells emit highly coherent, laser-like light, while diseased cells show diminished coherence and randomized patterns.
Diseased cells emit 50% more biophotons than healthy cells due to metabolic stress.
There is no measurable difference in biophoton emission; the difference is purely in the frequency of the aura.

questions.question: What is the 'Golden Ratio' of breath timing suggested in Lesson 3 to trigger the transition from the sympathetic to the parasympathetic state during activation?
